Dehydration: Running a half marathon can cause dehydration, which can lead to symptoms such as dizziness, nausea, and cramping.
Inadequate training: Participants who do not properly train for the race may experience muscle strains, sprains, and other injuries.
Poor nutrition: Consuming an inadequate diet before the race can lead to low energy levels and poor performance.
Inadequate hydration: Not drinking enough water before the race can lead to dehydration and other health problems.
Inadequate rest: Not getting enough rest before the race can lead to fatigue and decreased performance.
